text: Jürgen Moltmann (8 April 1926 - 3 June 2024) was a German Reformed theologian. He was born in Hamburg, Germany. He was Professor Emeritus of Systematic Theology at the University of Tübingen.. Moltmann worked in a number of areas of Christian theology, including systematic theology, eschatology, ecclesiology, political theology, Christology, pneumatology, and the theology of creation. He was the recipient of the 2000 University of Louisville and Louisville Presbyterian Theological Seminary Grawemeyer Award in Religion, and was also selected to deliver the prestigious Gifford Lectures in 1984–85. Moltmann died on 3 June 2024 in Tübingen, Germany at the age of 98.Theologe Jürgen Moltmann gestorben ==References== ==Other websites== *Jürgen Moltmann Reading Room : Extensive primary and secondary sources on-line (Tyndale Seminary) *English Language Bibliography of Moltmann's Works: Non-exhaustive, up to 1996 *Article on Moltmann at The Boston Collaborative Encyclopedia of Modern Western Theology Category:1926 births Category:2024 deaths Category:German theologians Category:German Protestants Category:People from Hamburg Category:German academics
